components.text: GOOD LIVING | TASTEMAKER
The Icon
By Catherine Hong

caption.text: MISTY COPELAND Principal ballerina, New York City

components.text: <caption-heading>Misty Copeland</caption-heading> Principal ballerina, New York City

Misty Copeland was 13, living in a San Pedro, California, motel with her mom and siblings, when she took her first ballet class at a Boys & Girls Club. It was an unassuming entry into an elite world (“the class was on a basketball court,” she recalls), but no matter: Her innate talent was unmistakable. Today, Copeland is one of the most acclaimed ballerinas in the world, with the distinction of being the first Black female principal dancer at American Ballet Theatre. She’s a rarity in her field for a wealth of other reasons, too. The star, who regularly sells out audiences for <glosa-i>Swan Lake</glosa-i> and <glosa-i>Firebird,</glosa-i> is the author of seven books and cofounder of Life in Motion Productions, a company dedicated to improving representation in the arts. As her friends know, she’s also a force in the kitchen (her salsa verde is legendary) and a fashion aficionado whose closet is an A-to-Z of joyful glam (Alexander Wang to Balmain to Louis Vuitton to Zimmermann, that is). And she’s passionate about interior design and collecting African American art. “Because I didn’t have a privileged background, I’ve always hungered to learn and grow,” she says. “Staying open to the wider world has probably made me a better artist, too.”
Her Essentials
1 | Black Ballerinas “My latest book for children is a celebration of 27 dancers of color who shaped history.” Aladdin; $20 bookshop.org.
CORPS STRENGTH
“The dancers of color in this book paved the way for me. I wanted to tell their stories so they wouldn’t be forgotten.”

2 | Skims Essential Scoop-Neck Bodysuit, in Onyx
“I live in this! Paired with skinny jeans and a hoodie, it’s my everyday streetwear.” $68 skims.com.

3 | Le Labo Neroli 36 Eau de Parfum
“I steal it from my husband. It has a unique warmth I love.” $198 for 50 ml lelabofragrances.com.

4 | Hampton Sun Spf 30 Mineral Mist
“It smells delicious and is so light—not at all sticky.” $34 for 6 oz. hamptonsuncare.com

5 | Celestial Seasonings Peppermint Tea
“I’ve never liked coffee, but I’ll have a calming cup of this any time of day.”

6 | Tiffany’s Paloma’s Graffiti Small Love Pendant, in Rose Gold
“My husband gave this to me when we were dating; I never take it off.” $900 tiffany.com.

7 | Rouge Hermès Lip Shine, in Poppy
“I love how it leaves a sheer, shimmery tint.” $69 hermes.com.

8 | Clinique Dramatically Different Moisturizing Lotion+
“This classic moisturizer is lightweight and unscented.” $33 for 125 ml clinique.com.

9 | Frame le Skinny de Jeanne Jeans, in Lupine
“I have muscular legs and a small waist, so it’s hard to find pairs that don’t make me look like the Hulk! These fit and have just the right stretch.” $228 frame-store.com

10 | Essie Nail Polish, in Mademoiselle
“A dancer’s nails have to be neutral. This has been my go-to since age 13.” $9 ulta.com.
11 | Apple Homepod Mini “We’re always telling Siri to turn on the music.” $99 apple.com.
WIN THIS
For a chance to win this speaker, go to win.marthastewart.com on May 5.
12 | Lovers Live, by Sade “This album reminds me of the earliest days with my husband.” $5 bn.com.
MOOD MUSIC
“I grew up listening to a lot of R&B and soul. It’s what I still go back to.”

13 | St~germain Elderflower Liqueur
“I add a splash to prosecco for a tiny hint of sweetness.” $35 for 750 ml reservebar.com.
14 | Farrow & Ball Paint, in Plummett No. 272 “My hallway is painted in this, with a high-gloss finish. It feels so glamorous and regal!” $115 a gallon farrow-ball.com.
CITY SLEEK
“ ‘Livable luxe’ is what my interior designer, Brigette Romanek, calls the vibe of my home. I love that phrase!”

15 | Breville Sous Chef Food Processor, 12 Inches
“I love to cook. I make pestos, salsas, and sauces with this.” $300 breville.com.

16 | Twizzlers
“I don’t believe in depriving myself. They’re timeless and not too sweet.”

17 | Another Mask to Hold (Mixed Media Collage, 2020), by Deborah Roberts
“Her work has such power and depth.” deborahrobertsart.com.

18 | White Orchids
“For holidays and my birthday, these are everywhere at home. I can’t get enough.”

COURTESY OF MASTERCLASS (PORTRAIT); PAUL BARDAGJY, COURTESY OF THE ARTIST, VIELMETTER LOS ANGELES, AND STEPHEN FRIEDMAN GALLERY, LONDON (DEBORAH ROBERTS COLLAGE); GETTY IMAGES (TEA, ORCHID); COURTESY OF MANUFACTURERS (OTHERS)
